column5: Thursday was a gorgeous day. -2 Celsius with low winds and some bluebird skies. Joey, Sarah and I went for some splake action (inspired by Joey's report) and tallied very well, with 20 fish hitting the ice. Most of them were fairly small, but we kept 7 for the frying pan...one of which is sitting in my belly as I type this.  Here are some photos and funny video. Hope you laugh and enjoy. Remember, we are laughing with her.        http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t8xWul79qjk
I was chatting with Matt tonight out on C. Bay. Was waiting to see the vid.
Nice going Chad & Co.   Some good eats in them splakes   You certainly having a great  season thus far Thanks for sharing and keep them reports coming! Jacques
Nice job icing those splake..... I think I reocginze that lake.
looks like a great outting          I wonder if Misfish made that seat    lol
Nice pic and love the video!!!... Been there and done that over the years and can't help but have a good laugh for sure!  Gotta love those Splake!... WTG!
Nice pix Chad.  Funny video. Thanx   U guys up north have it made.  We're still waiting  for ice!  16 C in Niagara yesterday!  Keep sending reports I love 'em!!
The makings of a fine meal or two for sure.  Love the video, laughed at exactly the right moment as I can definitely relate to it.
Always easier to laugh at someone's mishap rather than your own....thankfully there is no video of mine.      Nice report Chad, looks like an awesome day to be on the ice.
That Sarah looks like a good sport! She must be a keeper.  Jeremy----maybe you can find 1 like that!

A great sport! Out of 4 days we had off together, she agreed to fish for 3 of them! She really likes the taste of trout, so that helped a lot...as did the mild weather.  Sarah has a few cute, single friends here Jeremy
HA! Good stuff. I was half expecting the fish to squirm out of her hands and back down the hole after she dropped it the first time.
That made me chuckle Chad ! Thanks for the report. Looks like fun
